newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to issue T$3 bln in certificates of deposit.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to issue T$3 bln in certificates of deposit.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank said on Friday it would issue T$3 billion in two-month negotiable certificates of deposit (NCDs) later in the day.
Bids would close at 3.00 pm (0700 GMT), a central bank official said.

During a sustained stock rally in March and April, the central bank repeatedly issued NCDs, a move seen as aimed at keeping a lid on the loose liquidity that many experts said had been fuelling the stock market's upward surge.
The central bank has confirmed that it was responding to the liquidity sitution but denied that it was acting directly in response to the stock market bull run.
The stock market in recent week has entered a consolidation phase with recent daily turnover plunging to less than half of the record levels set during the big rally.
